evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew is evident in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the preliminary historical timeline, indicating the issue was present and observable in this context.

defeaters: Explicit evidence of communication failures or misunderstandings among crew during the incident
Clear statements or reports indicating coordination breakdown

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence shows communication between flight crew and headset operator and interaction between tug instructor and trainee, but no explicit indication of communication or coordination breakdown among crew is present; the incident of the aircraft moving beyond the TRP suggests a possible coordination issue but is not directly linked to communication breakdown (H1-H4).
outcome.uncertainty_source: absence of direct statements or observations about communication or coordination failures

node.statement: The mechanical/control failure in Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_t0_prelim is present and relevant.

defeaters: Evidence of a mechanical or control failure causing the aircraft to move beyond the TRP would change my mind.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence shows the aircraft moved beyond the tug release point and hit a barrier, but there is no direct indication of a mechanical or control failure causing this; the pushback was controlled by the tug instructor after seat swap (H2, H3).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence of mechanical/control failure; ambiguity whether the continued movement was due to failure or operational error.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA as of 12-25 during the hist_t0_prelim scope.

defeaters: If evidence showed missing, unclear, or damaged ground markings or environmental factors affecting the pushback.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided history items (H1-H4) mentions any environmental or marking deficiency being present or observable on the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the specified scope.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 is documented and available in the historical preliminary data set hist_t0_prelim.

assumptions: The historical data items H1-H4 are part of the hist_t0_prelim data set as stated in the scope.
defeaters: If the historical data set did not include this event or if the event was not recorded in the preliminary data set hist_t0_prelim.

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The historical data (H1-H4) documents the pushback event involving the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, including the procedural deviation where the aircraft moved beyond the Tug release point and hit the blast barrier, confirming the deviation is documented and available in the historical preliminary data set.
outcome.uncertainty_source: None significant; the evidence directly documents the event and deviation.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features observed in Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA operations on 12-25 as recorded in hist_t0_prelim.

assumptions: The described events represent the key features of the procedural deviation for this aircraft and date.
defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback procedure was standard without deviation or the aircraft did not move beyond the TRP, the conclusion would change.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features identified for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t0_prelim scope on 12-25.

If the aircraft had stopped correctly at the TRP as per key features

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: H4 directly states that the aircraft moved beyond the Tug release point ground markings, indicating the environmental or marking deficiency did not align with the key features for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA in the hist_t0_prelim scope.

node.statement: The identification of procedural deviation in pushback execution for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 is robust against potential defeaters within the hist_t0_prelim data context.

defeaters: Additional contradictory data showing alternative explanations for the deviation
Evidence of communication failures or unreported procedural errors

node.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure

defeaters: If evidence showed the instructor was not qualified or not present during the pushback.

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident withstands potential defeaters, as alternative explanations do not sufficiently account for the observed coordination failures in the preliminary historical timeline.

assumptions: Communication via interphone and visual cues should have prevented the pushback error if coordination was effective.
defeaters: Additional evidence showing alternative causes for the coordination failure, such as mechanical failure or external interference, would change my mind.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence shows communication and coordination actions among crew and tug operators (H1-H3), but the aircraft still moved beyond the TRP and hit a barrier (H4). While communication was present, the breakdown is implied by the outcome, and alternative explanations are not explicitly ruled out, so defeater resistance is weakly supported.
outcome.uncertainty_source: lack of explicit evidence ruling out alternative explanations for the coordination failure
